Job Details

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR:

GET MORE OUT OF YOUR CAREER
Choose a career where changing someone else’s life for the better is also life-changing for you – personally, professionally, and financially.
FINANCIAL PLANNING WITH NORTHWESTERN MUTUAL
Are you looking for more fulfillment from your career? Are you starting to think about a job change? Now’s the time to consider Northwestern Mutual.
Our financial professionals help clients reach their goals by developing and implementing financial plans to show clients where they are today, plan where they want to go tomorrow, and provide the financial tools and support to help them get there.

Target Audience for this Role:
This job is intended for financial advisors with an existing book-of-business.
This job is 100% commission-based but our fee payout schedule is made by advisors FOR advisors . Advisors usually make 50% to 180% more than at their previous firm.
Our fee structure starts at advisors making 100% of fee revenue and our lowest fee payout is 60% of fee revenue. Most advisors fall in the 80+% payout rate, which is significantly higher than the 10-40% payed out by most firms.
Additionally, we have incorporated profit-sharing, so if fee revenues to the firm are in excess of our expenses we pay that back out to advisors at the end of the year.
If you want the ability to act as a fiduciary and always act in your clients' best interests then this job is for you.

Job Description
New York Life Insurance Company and its affiliates are dedicated to prudent financial management, high-quality products, and impeccable service. Our financial professionals help clients develop a long term financial strategy to achieve their financial goals using a comprehensive array of financial products and services, including life insurance, fixed and variable* annuities, and mutual funds*.

The Wealth Management Associate Program (WMAP) is a 24-month development program designed to pipeline trainees to become a successful Financial Advisor in the Advisory Mastery Program (AMP). Wealth Management Associate trainees provide support to financial advisors in a number of ways including leveraging financial planning tools for client portfolios, providing technology training and support and assisting with business development activities. The goal of the Wealth Management Associate Program is to prepare trainees in all facets of financial advising with a focus on financial planning, leveraging technology tools and business development. Wealth Management Associate will learn how to create and present financial plans to clients, how to use the myriad of technological designed for advisor efficiency and building client portfolios. During the initial onboarding months, Wealth Management Associate trainees will be focused on getting their Securities Industry Essentials (SIE), Series 7, and Series 66. The WMAP program offers comprehensive education, training and mentorship of both technical and sales skills. The approach of the program fully positions WMAP trainees for success and long-term development. At the conclusion of the 24-month program, associates will transition into the Advisory Mastery Program (AMP) where they will become a Financial Advisor.

Overview
Our Financial Advisors act as advocates for clients and are committed to continually enhance, enrich, and serve their community. They problem-solve for their clients, researching and proposing educated financial strategies which leads to long-lasting, value-based client relationships. As a Financial Advisor with [Firm Name] you will gather, manage and service a book of investment-oriented clients by identifying and acquiring assets and developing additional business through referrals.
We take an uncommon approach to financial services, focusing on long‐term results and leveraging technology, exceptional relationship management and customized strategies to consumers and businesses.
It’s time to put yourself and your clients first. We’re looking to add new advisors to our team who share our passion and values.

The Financial Advisor is principally responsible for providing wealth management services to clients/prospects remotely and referral management. You are encouraged to meet your individual goals and assist with attaining the program sales and service goals. You must possess industry knowledge and familiarity with the myriad of products available to meet clients' objectives and needs. You are encouraged to act independently, with discretion and good judgment, and in the best interest of the client. You will be registered with Raymond James Financial and will conduct business on behalf of the Investments & Financial Services program.

What you will do here:
Client/Prospect Sales and Service: Responsible for consulting with prospects/clients to provide advice and identify products/strategies available based on the clients’ financial needs and goals that are in the clients’ best interest. You will work to identify prospect/client sales opportunities and consistently follow up and offer our services. You will be encouraged to build and maintain client relationships and provide ongoing client service within the client service model expectations. You will also be encouraged to participate in and facilitate ongoing business development activities, consumer education, and Credit Union employee training.

Responsible for managing referrals received for the Investments & Financial Services Program. You will actively make outbound contact attempts via phone & email for referrals received and prospect lists. You must be adept at engaging prospects over the phone to gauge interest and provide information regarding the services provided by the Investments & Financial Services program to build sales opportunities.

The Financial Advisor is responsible for various operational tasks for their client sales and service activities such as processing paperwork, client account maintenance, processing transactions, system data entry, CRM updates and documentation, etc. You must ensure you are independently meeting the standards of Federal and State regulatory agencies as well as adhering to the written policies and procedures of the broker/dealer and the Financial Institution.

Perform other job-related duties as assigned.


H.S. Diploma or GED required.

3+ years of financial industry experience required.

3+ years of sales experience, generating new sales opportunities required.

Strong written and verbal communication skills, presentation skills, planning skills, analytical skills, and problem solving skills required.

Effectively handle multiple task assignments simultaneously with above average problem solving skills with excellent organization skills and process with accuracy required.

Proven sales skills in insurance or related field exceeding sales quotas/goals required.

Ability to develop and maintain relationships via phone with clients, internal and external members required.

Ability to work effectively, both independently and in a team environment, in an atmosphere of multiple projects, shifting priorities, & deadline pressures required.

Microsoft Access, Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Word required.

Series 7 - General Securities Representative Qualification required.

Series 66 - Uniform Combined State Law 66 or both 63 & 65 required.

AZ Life/Health Insurance required.

Job Description:
Actively Hiring During COVID-19!

Job Description
New York Life Insurance Company and its affiliates are dedicated to prudent financial management, high-quality products, and impeccable service. Our financial professionals help clients develop a long term financial strategy to achieve their financial goals using a comprehensive array of financial products and services, including life insurance, fixed and variable* annuities, and mutual funds*.

Fast-growing financial planning firm is looking for a dedicated, ambitious, motivated self-starter seeking a career in financial planning. Individual must be detail-oriented, organized and possess great written and verbal communication skills. This is a great opportunity for someone with a deep genuine interest in the financial planning field looking for a long-term lucrative career.
Ideal candidate will have 2-3 years of experience working in the financial industry, preferably in investments and financial planning. Series 7 license and CFP® designation preferred but not required. Four-year college degree required.
Duties will include servicing current clients, preparing and updating financial plans and assisting advisor with marketing and business development. No direct sales or cold-calling required.
We offer full health benefits with vision and dental, retirement plan with profit-sharing, bonuses, education reimbursement and much more.

The Financial Advisor is principally responsible for providing wealth management services to clients/prospects remotely and referral management. You are encouraged to meet your individual goals and assist with attaining the program sales and service goals. You must possess industry knowledge and familiarity with the myriad of products available to meet clients' objectives and needs. You are encouraged to act independently, with discretion and good judgment, and in the best interest of the client. You will be registered with Raymond James Financial and will conduct business on behalf of the Investments & Financial Services program.

What you will do here:
Client/Prospect Sales and Service: Responsible for consulting with prospects/clients to provide advice and identify products/strategies available based on the clients’ financial needs and goals that are in the clients’ best interest. You will work to identify prospect/client sales opportunities and consistently follow up and offer our services. You will be encouraged to build and maintain client relationships and provide ongoing client service within the client service model expectations. You will also be encouraged to participate in and facilitate ongoing business development activities, consumer education, and Credit Union employee training.

Responsible for managing referrals received for the Investments & Financial Services Program. You will actively make outbound contact attempts via phone & email for referrals received and prospect lists. You must be adept at engaging prospects over the phone to gauge interest and provide information regarding the services provided by the Investments & Financial Services program to build sales opportunities.

The Financial Advisor is responsible for various operational tasks for their client sales and service activities such as processing paperwork, client account maintenance, processing transactions, system data entry, CRM updates and documentation, etc. You must ensure you are independently meeting the standards of Federal and State regulatory agencies as well as adhering to the written policies and procedures of the broker/dealer and the Financial Institution.

Perform other job-related duties as assigned.


H.S. Diploma or GED required.

3+ years of financial industry experience required.

3+ years of sales experience, generating new sales opportunities required.

Strong written and verbal communication skills, presentation skills, planning skills, analytical skills, and problem solving skills required.

Effectively handle multiple task assignments simultaneously with above average problem solving skills with excellent organization skills and process with accuracy required.

Proven sales skills in insurance or related field exceeding sales quotas/goals required.

Ability to develop and maintain relationships via phone with clients, internal and external members required.

Ability to work effectively, both independently and in a team environment, in an atmosphere of multiple projects, shifting priorities, & deadline pressures required.

Microsoft Access, Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Word required.

Series 7 - General Securities Representative Qualification required.

Series 66 - Uniform Combined State Law 66 or both 63 & 65 required.

AZ Life/Health Insurance required.

We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/D/V. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing.

Job Description
Title: Retirement Plan Consultant
Benefits: Healthcare, 401(k) Plan, Vacation/Sick
Status: Full-time/Exempt
Date: 10/25/2021
Opportunity Summary?
Are you looking to elevate your career in the financial services industry??
?As a Retirement Plan Consultant, you will be responsible for servicing key clients, networking, and promoting our suite of 401k plan retirement plan consulting services. You will work closely with senior consultants, professional contacts, and existing corporate clients in developing new clients. In addition, you will have some mentoring opportunities with the founder who built the business from the ground up. You will be able to focus 75% of your time on Client Service and 25% on Business Development activities. We are seeking an ambitious professional who has experience and contacts in the NW region and local Portland, OR marketplace.

The Financial Advisor is principally responsible for providing wealth management services to clients/prospects remotely and referral management. You are encouraged to meet your individual goals and assist with attaining the program sales and service goals. You must possess industry knowledge and familiarity with the myriad of products available to meet clients' objectives and needs. You are encouraged to act independently, with discretion and good judgment, and in the best interest of the client. You will be registered with Raymond James Financial and will conduct business on behalf of the Investments & Financial Services program.

What you will do here:
Client/Prospect Sales and Service: Responsible for consulting with prospects/clients to provide advice and identify products/strategies available based on the clients’ financial needs and goals that are in the clients’ best interest. You will work to identify prospect/client sales opportunities and consistently follow up and offer our services. You will be encouraged to build and maintain client relationships and provide ongoing client service within the client service model expectations. You will also be encouraged to participate in and facilitate ongoing business development activities, consumer education, and Credit Union employee training.

Responsible for managing referrals received for the Investments & Financial Services Program. You will actively make outbound contact attempts via phone & email for referrals received and prospect lists. You must be adept at engaging prospects over the phone to gauge interest and provide information regarding the services provided by the Investments & Financial Services program to build sales opportunities.

The Financial Advisor is responsible for various operational tasks for their client sales and service activities such as processing paperwork, client account maintenance, processing transactions, system data entry, CRM updates and documentation, etc. You must ensure you are independently meeting the standards of Federal and State regulatory agencies as well as adhering to the written policies and procedures of the broker/dealer and the Financial Institution.

Perform other job-related duties as assigned.


H.S. Diploma or GED required.

3+ years of financial industry experience required.

3+ years of sales experience, generating new sales opportunities required.

Strong written and verbal communication skills, presentation skills, planning skills, analytical skills, and problem solving skills required.

Effectively handle multiple task assignments simultaneously with above average problem solving skills with excellent organization skills and process with accuracy required.

Proven sales skills in insurance or related field exceeding sales quotas/goals required.

Ability to develop and maintain relationships via phone with clients, internal and external members required.

Ability to work effectively, both independently and in a team environment, in an atmosphere of multiple projects, shifting priorities, & deadline pressures required.

Microsoft Access, Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Word required.

Series 7 - General Securities Representative Qualification required.

Series 66 - Uniform Combined State Law 66 or both 63 & 65 required.

AZ Life/Health Insurance required.

We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/D/V. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing.

For additional information about our organization, careers, and benefits visit: http://www.desertfinancial.com/careers

Job Description

The Ameriprise Advisor Center (AAC) is a financial advising organization that interacts with its clients over the phone and through web-based meetings. Advisors in the AAC build deep and meaningful relationships focused on helping clients achieve their financial goals through our Confident Retirement ® approach.

The Financial Advisor in Training position is intended for those who want to become a financial advisor in a team environment. As a Financial Advisor in Training, we provide necessary support to obtain your Series 7 and 66 and life insurance licenses as you start getting exposure to working with clients by scheduling appointments for our financial advising teams. Once you obtain the required licensing, you will be eligible to advance your career by joining a financial advising team and working directly with clients on their needs.

Training and Professional Development:
We pride ourselves in providing best-in-class training and development to help our employees build the knowledge and skills to be successful financial advisors regardless of previous experience. Our learning pathways, on-the job mentorship and ongoing coaching are designed to help employees understand the products, services, systems and tools needed to provide high quality advice to clients.

The Ameriprise Advisor Center also believes in supporting its advisors developing expertise within the industry by offering tuition reimbursement and internal support to obtain key designations like the CFP®. Our support and training will lay the foundation needed for a rewarding career of helping clients feel more confident about their financial futures.

You will partner with our internal portfolio decision-makers, auxiliary research teams, client service associates, and renowned sales team to give our clients the best service possible. Through our unique training program, Fisher Investments offers an elevated finance and capital markets education to understand our firm’s unique approach. You will report to your group manager whose previous experience in the role will assist you in navigating client relationships and provide personalized career development.

The Wealth Management Associate Program (WMAP) is a 24-month development program designed to pipeline trainees to become a successful Financial Advisor in the Advisory Mastery Program (AMP). Wealth Management Associate trainees provide support to financial advisors in a number of ways including leveraging financial planning tools for client portfolios, providing technology training and support and assisting with business development activities. The goal of the Wealth Management Associate Program is to prepare trainees in all facets of financial advising with a focus on financial planning, leveraging technology tools and business development. Wealth Management Associate will learn how to create and present financial plans to clients, how to use the myriad of technological designed for advisor efficiency and building client portfolios. During the initial onboarding months, Wealth Management Associate trainees will be focused on getting their Securities Industry Essentials (SIE), Series 7, and Series 66. The WMAP program offers comprehensive education, training and mentorship of both technical and sales skills. The approach of the program fully positions WMAP trainees for success and long-term development. At the conclusion of the 24-month program, associates will transition into the Advisory Mastery Program (AMP) where they will become a Financial Advisor.

Job Title: Financial Advisor-We give you the prospects!(Salary+Comm)
Job Description:
We are a high-end boutique Wealth Management firm that is on a strong expansion path. We are selectively adding a financial advisor to accommodate our growth and excess appointments from our successful marketing efforts. This means that you won’t have to go prospecting for potential clients yourself; we do all the marketing legwork for our valued selected advisors.
You will be trained in our process and the way we do business for several months. In other words, you will be given time to “learn the ropes” before you meet with our prospects.
We believe that this is an opportunity that is very rare in this industry as advisors typically have to prospect for their own leads, that is why we are very selective due to the nature of our overall employment value offering. We are looking for dedicated, ethical, hardworking, and team-oriented individuals.
This position is permanently, fully remote.

Target Audience for this Role:
This job is intended for financial advisors with an existing book-of-business.
This job is 100% commission-based but our fee payout schedule is made by advisors FOR advisors . Advisors usually make 50% to 180% more than at their previous firm.
Our fee structure starts at advisors making 100% of fee revenue and our lowest fee payout is 60% of fee revenue. Most advisors fall in the 80+% payout rate, which is significantly higher than the 10-40% payed out by most firms.
Additionally, we have incorporated profit-sharing, so if fee revenues to the firm are in excess of our expenses we pay that back out to advisors at the end of the year.
If you want the ability to act as a fiduciary and always act in your clients' best interests then this job is for you.

Administration
· Maintain a “predictable environment” for Advisor and clients
· Prepare documents and presentations
· Scheduling client meetings, phone calls and/or video conferences
· Create, gather and organize collateral for client meetings
· Answer incoming correspondence via phone, email and mail
· Maintain client records, client relationship management (CRM) databases and compliance files, adhering to company guidelines

Job Description

The Ameriprise Advisor Center (AAC) is a financial advising organization that interacts with its clients over the phone and through web-based meetings. Advisors in the AAC build deep and meaningful relationships focused on helping clients achieve their financial goals through our Confident Retirement ® approach.

The Financial Advisor in Training position is intended for those who want to become a financial advisor in a team environment. As a Financial Advisor in Training, we provide necessary support to obtain your Series 7 and 66 and life insurance licenses as you start getting exposure to working with clients by scheduling appointments for our financial advising teams. Once you obtain the required licensing, you will be eligible to advance your career by joining a financial advising team and working directly with clients on their needs.

Training and Professional Development:
We pride ourselves in providing best-in-class training and development to help our employees build the knowledge and skills to be successful financial advisors regardless of previous experience. Our learning pathways, on-the job mentorship and ongoing coaching are designed to help employees understand the products, services, systems and tools needed to provide high quality advice to clients.

The Ameriprise Advisor Center also believes in supporting its advisors developing expertise within the industry by offering tuition reimbursement and internal support to obtain key designations like the CFP®. Our support and training will lay the foundation needed for a rewarding career of helping clients feel more confident about their financial futures.

The Wealth Management Associate Program (WMAP) is a 24-month development program designed to pipeline trainees to become a successful Financial Advisor in the Advisory Mastery Program (AMP). Wealth Management Associate trainees provide support to financial advisors in a number of ways including leveraging financial planning tools for client portfolios, providing technology training and support and assisting with business development activities. The goal of the Wealth Management Associate Program is to prepare trainees in all facets of financial advising with a focus on financial planning, leveraging technology tools and business development. Wealth Management Associate will learn how to create and present financial plans to clients, how to use the myriad of technological designed for advisor efficiency and building client portfolios. During the initial onboarding months, Wealth Management Associate trainees will be focused on getting their Securities Industry Essentials (SIE), Series 7, and Series 66. The WMAP program offers comprehensive education, training and mentorship of both technical and sales skills. The approach of the program fully positions WMAP trainees for success and long-term development. At the conclusion of the 24-month program, associates will transition into the Advisory Mastery Program (AMP) where they will become a Financial Advisor.

Job Title: Internal Wholesaler - National opening -open for work at home country wide
Job Description:
Saybrus Partners is looking for a self-motivated individual for the role of Internal Sales Consultant to assist their assigned external wholesaler in achieving regional and company sales goals by developing and initiating marketing campaigns, making proactive sales calls, maintaining relationships with and supporting assigned advisors and key distribution relationships. The Internal Sales Consultant plays a critical role in the success of Saybrus' distribution strategy.
Duties and Responsibilities
Providing sales support to inbound callers from key distribution partners, advisors and their staff.
Initiating and implementing marketing campaigns designed to target key advisors.
Identifying qualified prospects in a defined territory and initiating outgoing sales calls to these advisors.

Administration
· Maintain a “predictable environment” for Advisor and clients
· Prepare documents and presentations
· Scheduling client meetings, phone calls and/or video conferences
· Create, gather and organize collateral for client meetings
· Answer incoming correspondence via phone, email and mail
· Maintain client records, client relationship management (CRM) databases and compliance files, adhering to company guidelines

Target Audience for this Role:
This job is intended for financial advisors with an existing book-of-business.
This job is 100% commission-based but our fee payout schedule is made by advisors FOR advisors . Advisors usually make 50% to 180% more than at their previous firm.
Our fee structure starts at advisors making 100% of fee revenue and our lowest fee payout is 60% of fee revenue. Most advisors fall in the 80+% payout rate, which is significantly higher than the 10-40% payed out by most firms.
Additionally, we have incorporated profit-sharing, so if fee revenues to the firm are in excess of our expenses we pay that back out to advisors at the end of the year.
If you want the ability to act as a fiduciary and always act in your clients' best interests then this job is for you.

This is the perfect job for a recent college graduate seeking the uncapped earning potential of a financial sales career with the security of a base salary from an established company.
Please only apply if you are serious about a career in sales. This is not a portfolio management or financial advisory role.

Kingsview Wealth Management is a fast growing independent advisory partnership offering clients financial planning, investment management, tax and insurance services. Job Description:
Halo Investing is a well-funded, financial technology firm with the first independent multi-issuer platform focused on pre-defined outcome investing including structured notes, buffered ETFs and Fee-based Annuities. Structured Notes are a pre-defined outcome investment product offering downside protection, previously only available to the ultra-high net worth. Halo is empowering and democratizing access to the product by building technology to analyze, purchase and manage the full lifecycle while building efficiencies for issuing banks.
The Halo Marketplace Sales Team is seeking to hire a Portfolio Advisory Consultant to partner with our Regional Vice Presidents focusing on RIAs and B/Ds. The individual will be expected to serve as a consultant providing portfolio construction guidance and consulting to the largest and fastest-growing advisory groups across the US.
Key Responsibilities / Duties:

Job Title: Financial Advisor-We give you the prospects!(Salary+Comm)
Job Description:
We are a high-end boutique Wealth Management firm that is on a strong expansion path. We are selectively adding a financial advisor to accommodate our growth and excess appointments from our successful marketing efforts. This means that you won’t have to go prospecting for potential clients yourself; we do all the marketing legwork for our valued selected advisors.
You will be trained in our process and the way we do business for several months. In other words, you will be given time to “learn the ropes” before you meet with our prospects.
We believe that this is an opportunity that is very rare in this industry as advisors typically have to prospect for their own leads, that is why we are very selective due to the nature of our overall employment value offering. We are looking for dedicated, ethical, hardworking, and team-oriented individuals.
This position is permanently, fully remote.

Target Audience for this Role:
This job is intended for financial advisors with an existing book-of-business.
This job is 100% commission-based but our fee payout schedule is made by advisors FOR advisors . Advisors usually make 50% to 180% more than at their previous firm.
Our fee structure starts at advisors making 100% of fee revenue and our lowest fee payout is 60% of fee revenue. Most advisors fall in the 80+% payout rate, which is significantly higher than the 10-40% payed out by most firms.
Additionally, we have incorporated profit-sharing, so if fee revenues to the firm are in excess of our expenses we pay that back out to advisors at the end of the year.
If you want the ability to act as a fiduciary and always act in your clients' best interests then this job is for you.

Job Title: Financial Advisor-We give you the prospects!(Salary+Comm)
Job Description:
We are a high-end boutique Wealth Management firm that is on a strong expansion path. We are selectively adding a financial advisor to accommodate our growth and excess appointments from our successful marketing efforts. This means that you won’t have to go prospecting for potential clients yourself; we do all the marketing legwork for our valued selected advisors.
You will be trained in our process and the way we do business for several months. In other words, you will be given time to “learn the ropes” before you meet with our prospects.
We believe that this is an opportunity that is very rare in this industry as advisors typically have to prospect for their own leads, that is why we are very selective due to the nature of our overall employment value offering. We are looking for dedicated, ethical, hardworking, and team-oriented individuals.
This position is permanently, fully remote.

Kingsview Wealth Management is a fast growing independent advisory partnership offering clients financial planning, investment management, tax and insurance services. Halo Investing is a well-funded, financial technology firm with the first independent multi-issuer platform focused on pre-defined outcome investing including structured notes, buffered ETFs and Fee-based Annuities. Structured Notes are a pre-defined outcome investment product offering downside protection, previously only available to the ultra-high net worth. Halo is empowering and democratizing access to the product by building technology to analyze, purchase and manage the full lifecycle while building efficiencies for issuing banks.
The Halo Marketplace Sales Team is seeking to hire a Portfolio Advisory Consultant to partner with our Regional Vice Presidents focusing on RIAs and B/Ds. Job Description

The Ameriprise Advisor Center (AAC) is a financial advising organization that interacts with its clients over the phone and through web-based meetings. Advisors in the AAC build deep and meaningful relationships focused on helping clients achieve their financial goals through our Confident Retirement ® approach.

The Financial Advisor in Training position is intended for those who want to become a financial advisor in a team environment. As a Financial Advisor in Training, we provide necessary support to obtain your Series 7 and 66 and life insurance licenses as you start getting exposure to working with clients by scheduling appointments for our financial advising teams. Once you obtain the required licensing, you will be eligible to advance your career by joining a financial advising team and working directly with clients on their needs.

Training and Professional Development:
We pride ourselves in providing best-in-class training and development to help our employees build the knowledge and skills to be successful financial advisors regardless of previous experience. Our learning pathways, on-the job mentorship and ongoing coaching are designed to help employees understand the products, services, systems and tools needed to provide high quality advice to clients.

The Ameriprise Advisor Center also believes in supporting its advisors developing expertise within the industry by offering tuition reimbursement and internal support to obtain key designations like the CFP®. Our support and training will lay the foundation needed for a rewarding career of helping clients feel more confident about their financial futures.

The Wealth Management Associate Program (WMAP) is a 24-month development program designed to pipeline trainees to become a successful Financial Advisor in the Advisory Mastery Program (AMP). Wealth Management Associate trainees provide support to financial advisors in a number of ways including leveraging financial planning tools for client portfolios, providing technology training and support and assisting with business development activities. The goal of the Wealth Management Associate Program is to prepare trainees in all facets of financial advising with a focus on financial planning, leveraging technology tools and business development. Wealth Management Associate will learn how to create and present financial plans to clients, how to use the myriad of technological designed for advisor efficiency and building client portfolios. During the initial onboarding months, Wealth Management Associate trainees will be focused on getting their Securities Industry Essentials (SIE), Series 7, and Series 66. The WMAP program offers comprehensive education, training and mentorship of both technical and sales skills. The approach of the program fully positions WMAP trainees for success and long-term development. At the conclusion of the 24-month program, associates will transition into the Advisory Mastery Program (AMP) where they will become a Financial Advisor.

The Wealth Management Associate Program (WMAP) is a 24-month development program designed to pipeline trainees to become a successful Financial Advisor in the Advisory Mastery Program (AMP). Wealth Management Associate trainees provide support to financial advisors in a number of ways including leveraging financial planning tools for client portfolios, providing technology training and support and assisting with business development activities. The goal of the Wealth Management Associate Program is to prepare trainees in all facets of financial advising with a focus on financial planning, leveraging technology tools and business development. The WMAP program offers comprehensive education, training and mentorship of both technical and sales skills. Halo Investing is a well-funded, financial technology firm with the first independent multi-issuer platform focused on pre-defined outcome investing including structured notes, buffered ETFs and Fee-based Annuities. Structured Notes are a pre-defined outcome investment product offering downside protection, previously only available to the ultra-high net worth. Halo is empowering and democratizing access to the product by building technology to analyze, purchase and manage the full lifecycle while building efficiencies for issuing banks.
The Halo Marketplace Sales Team is seeking to hire a Portfolio Advisory Consultant to partner with our Regional Vice Presidents focusing on RIAs and B/Ds. The individual will be expected to serve as a consultant providing portfolio construction guidance and consulting to the largest and fastest-growing advisory groups across the US.
Key Responsibilities / Duties:

Target Audience for this Role:
This job is intended for financial advisors with an existing book-of-business.
This job is 100% commission-based but our fee payout schedule is made by advisors FOR advisors . Advisors usually make 50% to 180% more than at their previous firm.
Our fee structure starts at advisors making 100% of fee revenue and our lowest fee payout is 60% of fee revenue. Most advisors fall in the 80+% payout rate, which is significantly higher than the 10-40% payed out by most firms.
Additionally, we have incorporated profit-sharing, so if fee revenues to the firm are in excess of our expenses we pay that back out to advisors at the end of the year.
If you want the ability to act as a fiduciary and always act in your clients' best interests then this job is for you.

The Wealth Management Associate Program (WMAP) is a 24-month development program designed to pipeline trainees to become a successful Financial Advisor in the Advisory Mastery Program (AMP). Wealth Management Associate trainees provide support to financial advisors in a number of ways including leveraging financial planning tools for client portfolios, providing technology training and support and assisting with business development activities. The goal of the Wealth Management Associate Program is to prepare trainees in all facets of financial advising with a focus on financial planning, leveraging technology tools and business development. Wealth Management Associate will learn how to create and present financial plans to clients, how to use the myriad of technological designed for advisor efficiency and building client portfolios. During the initial onboarding months, Wealth Management Associate trainees will be focused on getting their Securities Industry Essentials (SIE), Series 7, and Series 66. The WMAP program offers comprehensive education, training and mentorship of both technical and sales skills. The approach of the program fully positions WMAP trainees for success and long-term development. At the conclusion of the 24-month program, associates will transition into the Advisory Mastery Program (AMP) where they will become a Financial Advisor.

Job Title: Senior Financial Advisor Fast Track for Management
Job Description:
Actively Hiring During COVID-19!
Office Location: NEW YORK LIFE - White Plains, NY
We’re looking for leadership-oriented individuals to join our Fast Track Management Program. In this program, you’ll have the opportunity to accelerate your path to management, and advance within 12 months.
Job Description
New York Life Insurance Company and its affiliates are dedicated to prudent financial management, high-quality products, and impeccable service. Our financial professionals help clients develop a long term financial strategy to achieve their financial goals using a comprehensive array of financial products and services, including life insurance, fixed and variable* annuities, and mutual funds*.

Target Audience for this Role:
This job is intended for financial advisors with an existing book-of-business.
This job is 100% commission-based but our fee payout schedule is made by advisors FOR advisors . Advisors usually make 50% to 180% more than at their previous firm.
Our fee structure starts at advisors making 100% of fee revenue and our lowest fee payout is 60% of fee revenue. Most advisors fall in the 80+% payout rate, which is significantly higher than the 10-40% payed out by most firms.
Additionally, we have incorporated profit-sharing, so if fee revenues to the firm are in excess of our expenses we pay that back out to advisors at the end of the year.
If you want the ability to act as a fiduciary and always act in your clients' best interests then this job is for you.

Change how the world invests, one client at a time

Identify client needs and work with internal partners to determine a solution. Partner with sales executives in business development and sales processes.

Job Title: Financial Advisor-We give you the prospects!(Salary+Comm)
Job Description:
We are a high-end boutique Wealth Management firm that is on a strong expansion path. We are selectively adding a financial advisor to accommodate our growth and excess appointments from our successful marketing efforts. This means that you won’t have to go prospecting for potential clients yourself; we do all the marketing legwork for our valued selected advisors.
You will be trained in our process and the way we do business for several months. In other words, you will be given time to “learn the ropes” before you meet with our prospects.
We believe that this is an opportunity that is very rare in this industry as advisors typically have to prospect for their own leads, that is why we are very selective due to the nature of our overall employment value offering. We are looking for dedicated, ethical, hardworking, and team-oriented individuals.
This position is permanently, fully remote.

The Ameriprise Advisor Center also believes in supporting its advisors developing expertise within the industry by offering tuition reimbursement and internal support to obtain key designations like the CFP®. Our support and training will lay the foundation needed for a rewarding career of helping clients feel more confident about their financial futures.

The Wealth Management Associate Program (WMAP) is a 24-month development program designed to pipeline trainees to become a successful Financial Advisor in the Advisory Mastery Program (AMP). Wealth Management Associate trainees provide support to financial advisors in a number of ways including leveraging financial planning tools for client portfolios, providing technology training and support and assisting with business development activities. The goal of the Wealth Management Associate Program is to prepare trainees in all facets of financial advising with a focus on financial planning, leveraging technology tools and business development. Wealth Management Associate will learn how to create and present financial plans to clients, how to use the myriad of technological designed for advisor efficiency and building client portfolios. During the initial onboarding months, Wealth Management Associate trainees will be focused on getting their Securities Industry Essentials (SIE), Series 7, and Series 66. The WMAP program offers comprehensive education, training and mentorship of both technical and sales skills. The approach of the program fully positions WMAP trainees for success and long-term development. At the conclusion of the 24-month program, associates will transition into the Advisory Mastery Program (AMP) where they will become a Financial Advisor.

Target Audience for this Role:
This job is intended for financial advisors with an existing book-of-business.
This job is 100% commission-based but our fee payout schedule is made by advisors FOR advisors . Advisors usually make 50% to 180% more than at their previous firm.
Our fee structure starts at advisors making 100% of fee revenue and our lowest fee payout is 60% of fee revenue. Most advisors fall in the 80+% payout rate, which is significantly higher than the 10-40% payed out by most firms.
Additionally, we have incorporated profit-sharing, so if fee revenues to the firm are in excess of our expenses we pay that back out to advisors at the end of the year.
If you want the ability to act as a fiduciary and always act in your clients' best interests then this job is for you.

Key Responsibilities

The Wealth Management Associate Program (WMAP) is a 24-month development program designed to pipeline trainees to become a successful Financial Advisor in the Advisory Mastery Program (AMP). Wealth Management Associate trainees provide support to financial advisors in a number of ways including leveraging financial planning tools for client portfolios, providing technology training and support and assisting with business development activities. The goal of the Wealth Management Associate Program is to prepare trainees in all facets of financial advising with a focus on financial planning, leveraging technology tools and business development. Wealth Management Associate will learn how to create and present financial plans to clients, how to use the myriad of technological designed for advisor efficiency and building client portfolios. During the initial onboarding months, Wealth Management Associate trainees will be focused on getting their Securities Industry Essentials (SIE), Series 7, and Series 66. The WMAP program offers comprehensive education, training and mentorship of both technical and sales skills. The approach of the program fully positions WMAP trainees for success and long-term development. At the conclusion of the 24-month program, associates will transition into the Advisory Mastery Program (AMP) where they will become a Financial Advisor.

U.S. Retirement & Benefits Partners (USRBP) is one of the largest independently owned insurance brokerage firms in the country providing a full range of employee benefits, compliance, and HR consulting services, along with retirement solutions for both the private and public sectors. For more information about USRBP, please visit our website: www.usrbpartners.com.

Company/Position Overview
Midwest Wealth Management’s wealth advisors deliver one-on-one goal-based wealth management, including planning for retirement, education, legacy, and other life goals through investment advice and guidance to help manage risk, improve performance, and ensure the growth and longevity of our client’s financial position.

Target Audience for this Role:
This job is intended for financial advisors with an existing book-of-business.
This job is 100% commission-based but our fee payout schedule is made by advisors FOR advisors . Advisors usually make 50% to 180% more than at their previous firm.
Our fee structure starts at advisors making 100% of fee revenue and our lowest fee payout is 60% of fee revenue. Most advisors fall in the 80+% payout rate, which is significantly higher than the 10-40% payed out by most firms.
Additionally, we have incorporated profit-sharing, so if fee revenues to the firm are in excess of our expenses we pay that back out to advisors at the end of the year.
If you want the ability to act as a fiduciary and always act in your clients' best interests then this job is for you.

Halo Investing is a well-funded, financial technology firm with the first independent multi-issuer platform focused on pre-defined outcome investing including structured notes, buffered ETFs and Fee-based Annuities. Structured Notes are a pre-defined outcome investment product offering downside protection, previously only available to the ultra-high net worth. Halo is empowering and democratizing access to the product by building technology to analyze, purchase and manage the full lifecycle while building efficiencies for issuing banks.

We pride ourselves in providing best-in-class training and development to help our employees build the knowledge and skills to be successful financial advisors regardless of previous experience. We are selectively adding a financial advisor to accommodate our growth and excess appointments from our successful marketing efforts. Wealth Management Associate trainees provide support to financial advisors in a number of ways including leveraging financial planning tools for client portfolios, providing technology training and support and assisting with business development activities. The goal of the Wealth Management Associate Program is to prepare trainees in all facets of financial advising with a focus on financial planning, leveraging technology tools and business development. Wealth Management Associate will learn how to create and present financial plans to clients, how to use the myriad of technological designed for advisor efficiency and building client portfolios. During the initial onboarding months, Wealth Management Associate trainees will be focused on getting their Securities Industry Essentials (SIE), Series 7, and Series 66. The WMAP program offers comprehensive education, training and mentorship of both technical and sales skills. The approach of the program fully positions WMAP trainees for success and long-term development. At the conclusion of the 24-month program, associates will transition into the Advisory Mastery Program (AMP) where they will become a Financial Advisor.

Our benefits division, U.S. Employee Benefits Services Group (USEBSG), provides an array of employee benefit solutions that include plan design, core and voluntary products, online enrollment, plan administration, third party administration, specialty health plans, and HR compliance through our Partner Firms.

Target Audience for this Role:
This job is intended for financial advisors with an existing book-of-business.
This job is 100% commission-based but our fee payout schedule is made by advisors FOR advisors . Advisors usually make 50% to 180% more than at their previous firm.
Our fee structure starts at advisors making 100% of fee revenue and our lowest fee payout is 60% of fee revenue. Most advisors fall in the 80+% payout rate, which is significantly higher than the 10-40% payed out by most firms.

The Wealth Management Associate Program (WMAP) is a 24-month development program designed to pipeline trainees to become a successful Financial Advisor in the Advisory Mastery Program (AMP). Wealth Management Associate trainees provide support to financial advisors in a number of ways including leveraging financial planning tools for client portfolios, providing technology training and support and assisting with business development activities. The goal of the Wealth Management Associate Program is to prepare trainees in all facets of financial advising with a focus on financial planning, leveraging technology tools and business development. Wealth Management Associate will learn how to create and present financial plans to clients, how to use the myriad of technological designed for advisor efficiency and building client portfolios. During the initial onboarding months, Wealth Management Associate trainees will be focused on getting their Securities Industry Essentials (SIE), Series 7, and Series 66. The WMAP program offers comprehensive education, training and mentorship of both technical and sales skills. The approach of the program fully positions WMAP trainees for success and long-term development. At the conclusion of the 24-month program, associates will transition into the Advisory Mastery Program (AMP) where they will become a Financial Advisor.

Job Title: Financial Advisor-We give you the prospects!(Salary+Comm)
Job Description:
We are a high-end boutique Wealth Management firm that is on a strong expansion path. We are selectively adding a financial advisor to accommodate our growth and excess appointments from our successful marketing efforts. This means that you won’t have to go prospecting for potential clients yourself; we do all the marketing legwork for our valued selected advisors.
You will be trained in our process and the way we do business for several months. In other words, you will be given time to “learn the ropes” before you meet with our prospects.
We believe that this is an opportunity that is very rare in this industry as advisors typically have to prospect for their own leads, that is why we are very selective due to the nature of our overall employment value offering. We are looking for dedicated, ethical, hardworking, and team-oriented individuals.
This position is permanently, fully remote.

Target Audience for this Role:
This job is intended for financial advisors with an existing book-of-business.
This job is 100% commission-based but our fee payout schedule is made by advisors FOR advisors . Advisors usually make 50% to 180% more than at their previous firm.
Our fee structure starts at advisors making 100% of fee revenue and our lowest fee payout is 60% of fee revenue. Most advisors fall in the 80+% payout rate, which is significantly higher than the 10-40% payed out by most firms.
Additionally, we have incorporated profit-sharing, so if fee revenues to the firm are in excess of our expenses we pay that back out to advisors at the end of the year.
If you want the ability to act as a fiduciary and always act in your clients' best interests then this job is for you.

The Wealth Management Associate Program (WMAP) is a 24-month development program designed to pipeline trainees to become a successful Financial Advisor in the Advisory Mastery Program (AMP). Wealth Management Associate trainees provide support to financial advisors in a number of ways including leveraging financial planning tools for client portfolios, providing technology training and support and assisting with business development activities. The goal of the Wealth Management Associate Program is to prepare trainees in all facets of financial advising with a focus on financial planning, leveraging technology tools and business development. Wealth Management Associate will learn how to create and present financial plans to clients, how to use the myriad of technological designed for advisor efficiency and building client portfolios. During the initial onboarding months, Wealth Management Associate trainees will be focused on getting their Securities Industry Essentials (SIE), Series 7, and Series 66. The WMAP program offers comprehensive education, training and mentorship of both technical and sales skills. The approach of the program fully positions WMAP trainees for success and long-term development. At the conclusion of the 24-month program, associates will transition into the Advisory Mastery Program (AMP) where they will become a Financial Advisor.

Internal Wholesaler
Position Summary
Provide education and support of CNL distributed products to various investment advisors and registered representatives “financial professionals” in a specific territory. Responsible for developing and expanding relationships with financial professionals in the CNL network of Investment Advisory Firms and Broker Dealers. This position will offer a flexible working arrangement (hybrid of office and remote working days).
Essential Job Functions
Develop new and build upon existing relationships with financial professionals/ registered representatives in the Broker Dealer network within their territory

Target Audience for this Role:
This job is intended for financial advisors with an existing book-of-business.
This job is 100% commission-based but our fee payout schedule is made by advisors FOR advisors . Advisors usually make 50% to 180% more than at their previous firm.
Our fee structure starts at advisors making 100% of fee revenue and our lowest fee payout is 60% of fee revenue. Most advisors fall in the 80+% payout rate, which is significantly higher than the 10-40% payed out by most firms.
Additionally, we have incorporated profit-sharing, so if fee revenues to the firm are in excess of our expenses we pay that back out to advisors at the end of the year.
If you want the ability to act as a fiduciary and always act in your clients' best interests then this job is for you.

Halo Investing is a well-funded, financial technology firm with the first independent multi-issuer platform focused on pre-defined outcome investing including structured notes, buffered ETFs and Fee-based Annuities. Structured Notes are a pre-defined outcome investment product offering downside protection, previously only available to the ultra-high net worth. Halo is empowering and democratizing access to the product by building technology to analyze, purchase and manage the full lifecycle while building efficiencies for issuing banks.
The Halo Marketplace Sales Team is seeking to hire a Portfolio Advisory Consultant to partner with our Regional Vice Presidents focusing on RIAs and B/Ds. The individual will be expected to serve as a consultant providing portfolio construction guidance and consulting to the largest and fastest-growing advisory groups across the US.

Career Description: Financial Advisors help clients identify and achieve their financial goals. Specific duties include meeting with clients and maintaining client relationships, creating and implementing customizable financial solutions for individuals and businesses with respect to financial, business, and estate planning, and analyzing relevant information in light of specific client considerations, including risk and asset management, education funding, retirement and tax considerations, business succession plans, legacy planning, and charitable bequests.

Manage their own work schedule and establish an attractive work/life balance.
Build their career with significant income potential.

Enjoy recognition and rewards for their financial achievements.

Financial Advisor / Registered Representative / Agent
Career Description: Financial Professionals help clients identify and achieve their financial goals. Through New York Life, Eagle Strategies and NYLIFE Securities, our Financial Professionals offer a comprehensive array of financial products and services to help clients develop a long-term financial strategy. New York Life and its affiliates are dedicated to prudent financial management, high-quality products and impeccable service. Financial strategies may include but are not limited to: risk management, retirement planning, education funding, business planning, employee benefits, specials needs planning, legacy and estate planning.
Training, Support and Professional Development: New York Life offers a comprehensive three-year training program, marketing support, as well as prospecting and technical assistance. Our mentoring programs give you the opportunity to work with highly successful, established agents and managers who assist you in developing a clientele. New York Life provides the resources and ongoing support you would expect from a Fortune 100 company, with the ability to run your own practice.

U.S. Retirement & Benefits Partners (USRBP) is one of the largest independently owned insurance brokerage firms in the country providing a full range of employee benefits, compliance, and HR consulting services, along with retirement solutions for both the private and public sectors. The business was formed in 2008 and today serves over three million participants nationally in the K-12, Corporate and Government markets. For more information about USRBP, please visit our website: www.usrbpartners.com.
Our benefits division, U.S. Employee Benefits Services Group (USEBSG), provides an array of employee benefit solutions that include plan design, core and voluntary products, online enrollment, plan administration, third party administration, specialty health plans, and HR compliance through our Partner Firms.
We are looking for a Financial Advisor to join our Partner Firm, Mutual, Inc. located on Long Island in Farmingville NY. https://www.planmember.com/mutualinc

The Wealth Management Associate Program (WMAP) is a 24-month development program designed to pipeline trainees to become a successful Financial Advisor in the Advisory Mastery Program (AMP). Wealth Management Associate trainees provide support to financial advisors in a number of ways including leveraging financial planning tools for client portfolios, providing technology training and support and assisting with business development activities. The goal of the Wealth Management Associate Program is to prepare trainees in all facets of financial advising with a focus on financial planning, leveraging technology tools and business development. Wealth Management Associate will learn how to create and present financial plans to clients, how to use the myriad of technological designed for advisor efficiency and building client portfolios. During the initial onboarding months, Wealth Management Associate trainees will be focused on getting their Securities Industry Essentials (SIE), Series 7, and Series 66. The WMAP program offers comprehensive education, training and mentorship of both technical and sales skills. The approach of the program fully positions WMAP trainees for success and long-term development. At the conclusion of the 24-month program, associates will transition into the Advisory Mastery Program (AMP) where they will become a Financial Advisor.

Are you looking to elevate your career in the financial services industry??
?As a Retirement Plan Consultant, you will be responsible for servicing key clients, networking, and promoting our suite of 401k plan retirement plan consulting services. Job Title: Financial Advisor-We give you the prospects!(Salary+Comm)
Job Description:
We are a high-end boutique Wealth Management firm that is on a strong expansion path. We are selectively adding a financial advisor to accommodate our growth and excess appointments from our successful marketing efforts. This means that you won’t have to go prospecting for potential clients yourself; we do all the marketing legwork for our valued selected advisors.
You will be trained in our process and the way we do business for several months. In other words, you will be given time to “learn the ropes” before you meet with our prospects.
We believe that this is an opportunity that is very rare in this industry as advisors typically have to prospect for their own leads, that is why we are very selective due to the nature of our overall employment value offering. We are looking for dedicated, ethical, hardworking, and team-oriented individuals.
This position is permanently, fully remote.

Target Audience for this Role:
This job is intended for financial advisors with an existing book-of-business.
This job is 100% commission-based but our fee payout schedule is made by advisors FOR advisors . Advisors usually make 50% to 180% more than at their previous firm.
Our fee structure starts at advisors making 100% of fee revenue and our lowest fee payout is 60% of fee revenue. Most advisors fall in the 80+% payout rate, which is significantly higher than the 10-40% payed out by most firms.
Additionally, we have incorporated profit-sharing, so if fee revenues to the firm are in excess of our expenses we pay that back out to advisors at the end of the year.
If you want the ability to act as a fiduciary and always act in your clients' best interests then this job is for you.

The Capital Group
Job Description

Our growing retirement plan advisory business has an opportunity for a detail-oriented team member with a minimum 3+ years’ experience in the retirement plan services and/or financial services industry. We are specifically looking for someone experienced in managing qualified and non-qualified plans. As our RIA department continues to grow, we seek a candidate to work with our retirement plans as the day to day contact. You will support the Retirement Plans Account Executive and manage plans directly as the point of contact for client service delivery. All applicants must display a positive and proactive attitude, strong organizational skills, exemplary customer service skills, and the ability to prioritize and multitask.

Job Title: Financial Advisor – St. Petersburg, FL/Work From Home
Job Description:
Job Description Summary
The Transamerica Advice Center is growing and is seeking experienced financial services professionals to help serve their clients with their retirement plan assets. Are you an experienced Financial Advisor or Retirement Professional who is tired of prospecting and would love to work with ongoing, warm leads, building relationships, and assisting clients with their financial challenges? Do you wish that instead of a high pressure, commission only position you could work in a comfortable office for 40 hours a week, receive an ongoing salary PLUS monthly, quarterly, and annual bonuses? If your answer is yes, we are looking for you!
Job Description
What You Will Do:
You will serve as a trusted advisor to the participants of Transamerica’s expansive book of qualified retirement accounts from Transamerica’s employer sponsored plans, helping participants to understand their options with their qualified savings, assisting them in setting goals, calculating exactly what it will take to achieve those goals, and implementing the plan.

Are you an entrepreneurial self-starter, ready for a career path where you can grow your own business and positively impact your community? Does the idea of building relationships and finding strategic solutions for clients excite you? If so, a Financial Advisor* role with this established Fortune 250 firm might be a great next step for you.
This Financial Advisory firm's focus on long‐term results and leveraging technology, while offering holistic financial planning, sets them apart in the financial services industry. If you'd like to work in a fast-paced career starting as a Financial Representative and earning your securities license to become a fully-licensed Financial Advisor, adding value to your community and creating financial freedom for yourself, keep reading!

Fisher Investments is seeking Investment Advisor to join their team in Camas, WA!
**This position is temporarily remote due to COVID-19**
Job Summary:
Stop prospecting! Come join our firm as an Investment Advisor for a provided roster of high-net-worth clients. Since 1995, Fisher Investments has developed a specialized approach focused on our private clients. With a firm structure that practices separation of sales and client service, you don’t have to wear the "many hats" of a typical Financial Advisor. Now is your opportunity to use your finance experience to better the investment universe.
As an Investment Advisor, you are the voice of Fisher Investments to our clients in the United States. You will partner with our internal portfolio decision-makers, auxiliary research teams, client service associates, and renowned sales team to give our clients the best service possible. With our commitment to being a fee-only fiduciary firm, you’ll appreciate knowing our compensation structure aligns with our client's best interests without relying on commissions. Through our unique training program, Fisher Investments offers an elevated finance and capital markets education to understand our firm’s unique approach. You will report to your group manager whose previous experience in the role will assist you in navigating client relationships and provide personalized career development.

The Wealth Management Associate Program (WMAP) is a 24-month development program designed to pipeline trainees to become a successful Financial Advisor in the Advisory Mastery Program (AMP). Wealth Management Associate trainees provide support to financial advisors in a number of ways including leveraging financial planning tools for client portfolios, providing technology training and support and assisting with business development activities. The goal of the Wealth Management Associate Program is to prepare trainees in all facets of financial advising with a focus on financial planning, leveraging technology tools and business development. Wealth Management Associate will learn how to create and present financial plans to clients, how to use the myriad of technological designed for advisor efficiency and building client portfolios. During the initial onboarding months, Wealth Management Associate trainees will be focused on getting their Securities Industry Essentials (SIE), Series 7, and Series 66. The WMAP program offers comprehensive education, training and mentorship of both technical and sales skills. The approach of the program fully positions WMAP trainees for success and long-term development. At the conclusion of the 24-month program, associates will transition into the Advisory Mastery Program (AMP) where they will become a Financial Advisor.

The Capital Group
Job Description
Retirement Plan Consultant
Our growing retirement plan advisory business has an opportunity for a detail-oriented team member with a minimum 3+ years’ experience in the retirement plan services and/or financial services industry. We are specifically looking for someone experienced in managing qualified and non-qualified plans. As our RIA department continues to grow, we seek a candidate to work with our retirement plans as the day to day contact. You will support the Retirement Plans Account Executive and manage plans directly as the point of contact for client service delivery. All applicants must display a positive and proactive attitude, strong organizational skills, exemplary customer service skills, and the ability to prioritize and multitask.
Job Details
Salary: $60,000.00 - $75,000.00 per year - Quarterly bonus opportunity
Job Type: Full-time EDUCATION/LICENSURE REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, or equivalent experience

Target Audience for this Role:
This job is intended for financial advisors with an existing book-of-business.
This job is 100% commission-based but our fee payout schedule is made by advisors FOR advisors . Advisors usually make 50% to 180% more than at their previous firm.
Our fee structure starts at advisors making 100% of fee revenue and our lowest fee payout is 60% of fee revenue. Most advisors fall in the 80+% payout rate, which is significantly higher than the 10-40% payed out by most firms.
Additionally, we have incorporated profit-sharing, so if fee revenues to the firm are in excess of our expenses we pay that back out to advisors at the end of the year.
If you want the ability to act as a fiduciary and always act in your clients' best interests then this job is for you.

Halo Investing is a well-funded, financial technology firm with the first independent multi-issuer platform focused on pre-defined outcome investing including structured notes, buffered ETFs and Fee-based Annuities. Structured Notes are a pre-defined outcome investment product offering downside protection, previously only available to the ultra-high net worth. Halo is empowering and democratizing access to the product by building technology to analyze, purchase and manage the full lifecycle while building efficiencies for issuing banks.
The Halo Marketplace Sales Team is seeking to hire a Portfolio Advisory Consultant to partner with our Regional Vice Presidents focusing on RIAs and B/Ds. The individual will be expected to serve as a consultant providing portfolio construction guidance and consulting to the largest and fastest-growing advisory groups across the US.
Key Responsibilities / Duties:

Administration
· Maintain a “predictable environment” for Advisor and clients
· Prepare documents and presentations
· Scheduling client meetings, phone calls and/or video conferences
· Create, gather and organize collateral for client meetings
· Answer incoming correspondence via phone, email and mail
· Maintain client records, client relationship management (CRM) databases and compliance files, adhering to company guidelines

The Wealth Management Associate Program (WMAP) is a 24-month development program designed to pipeline trainees to become a successful Financial Advisor in the Advisory Mastery Program (AMP). Wealth Management Associate trainees provide support to financial advisors in a number of ways including leveraging financial planning tools for client portfolios, providing technology training and support and assisting with business development activities. The goal of the Wealth Management Associate Program is to prepare trainees in all facets of financial advising with a focus on financial planning, leveraging technology tools and business development. Wealth Management Associate will learn how to create and present financial plans to clients, how to use the myriad of technological designed for advisor efficiency and building client portfolios. During the initial onboarding months, Wealth Management Associate trainees will be focused on getting their Securities Industry Essentials (SIE), Series 7, and Series 66. The WMAP program offers comprehensive education, training and mentorship of both technical and sales skills. The approach of the program fully positions WMAP trainees for success and long-term development. At the conclusion of the 24-month program, associates will transition into the Advisory Mastery Program (AMP) where they will become a Financial Advisor.

Company/Position Overview
Midwest Wealth Management’s wealth advisors deliver one-on-one goal-based wealth management, including planning for retirement, education, legacy, and other life goals through investment advice and guidance to help manage risk, improve performance, and ensure the growth and longevity of our client’s financial position.

Target Audience for this Role:
This job is intended for financial advisors with an existing book-of-business.
This job is 100% commission-based but our fee payout schedule is made by advisors FOR advisors . Advisors usually make 50% to 180% more than at their previous firm.
Our fee structure starts at advisors making 100% of fee revenue and our lowest fee payout is 60% of fee revenue. Most advisors fall in the 80+% payout rate, which is significantly higher than the 10-40% payed out by most firms.
Additionally, we have incorporated profit-sharing, so if fee revenues to the firm are in excess of our expenses we pay that back out to advisors at the end of the year.
If you want the ability to act as a fiduciary and always act in your clients' best interests then this job is for you.

Fisher Investments is seeking Investment Advisor to join their team in Camas, WA!
**This position is temporarily remote due to COVID-19**
Job Summary:
Stop prospecting! Come join our firm as an Investment Advisor for a provided roster of high-net-worth clients. Since 1995, Fisher Investments has developed a specialized approach focused on our private clients. With a firm structure that practices separation of sales and client service, you don’t have to wear the "many hats" of a typical Financial Advisor. Now is your opportunity to use your finance experience to better the investment universe.
As an Investment Advisor, you are the voice of Fisher Investments to our clients in the United States. You will partner with our internal portfolio decision-makers, auxiliary research teams, client service associates, and renowned sales team to give our clients the best service possible. With our commitment to being a fee-only fiduciary firm, you’ll appreciate knowing our compensation structure aligns with our client's best interests without relying on commissions. Through our unique training program, Fisher Investments offers an elevated finance and capital markets education to understand our firm’s unique approach. You will report to your group manager whose previous experience in the role will assist you in navigating client relationships and provide personalized career development.

Our goal is to attract, retain and support the best people. If you are organized, a problem solver, detail oriented, open to challenge, have great communication and business skills, are comfortable working independently in a fast-paced business environment, we are interested in meeting you.
If you are career-oriented with good listening skills, have a support orientation, and you’re self-motivated, we are interested in meeting you. If your math and spreadsheet skills are great, we are interested in meeting you. If you have experience in accounting, tax, financial planning, this position will be a good fit. If you’re interested to join a successful, fast growing, wealth management practice in the role of supporting Advisors, please apply. Compensation includes salary plus team-driven incentive income. Ample opportunities for advancement.
Wunder Financial is one of the largest wealth management practices within Northwestern Mutual, managing over $800M in investment assets for nearly 400 households. Wunder Financial provides quality support to a variety of clients in the tri-state area and throughout the United States. The relationship and partnership we establish with our clients enables us to inform their financial security planning in meaningful ways and can make for a gratifying career for the right candidate.

A career with Securian Financial Advisors of the Great Lakes offers a flexible schedule and an opportunity to earn an excellent income. Our team approach gives you an advantage as you build your practice, and provides your clients with supportive specialists that work together to help others achieve financial success. As a wealth management advisor, each solution you help implement makes a lasting impact to help secure the financial future of your clients, their families or their business.
We specialize in Comprehensive fee-based planning, asset and investment management, risk management and insurance, qualified plans, tax-related strategies, business planning and estate planning.
For inexperienced advisors, we offer: a unique 4.5 year training and partnership program that is designed to provide income stability, while still allowing top performers to maximize their earning, a professional work environment and a full benefits package, a six month intensive training program that includes classroom, online and field training, as well as the opportunity to develop a great career path.
